intro: Pelea clusiifolia var. sapotifolia, commonly known as the sapotilla pelea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically harvested when ripe, often used in culinary or ornamental contexts. It thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
